item.title: Micah 1
item.description:
Micah Chapter 1

1 A Message from Yahveh to Micah from Moresheth at the Time of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, Kings of Judah. What He Saw About Samaria and Jerusalem Judgment Against Samaria and Jerusalem

2 Listen, every nation; listen, world and everybody in it. Let the Lord Yahveh testify against you from his holy Temple.

3 He’s coming down from his place to walk on the mountaintops.

4 The mountains will mash down under his feet and cascade into the valleysâ€” like wax in fire or water on a slope.

item.title: Micah 2
item.description:
Micah Chapter 2

1 Misfortune awaits those who devise sin, Who lie awake plotting schemes in bed! In the morning they do them because they can.

2 They covet fields and seize them; they desire horses and take them. They rob people and confiscate the property they’ve inherited.

3 So Yahveh says, “I’m devising a catastrophe for this family; you won’t get your necks out of the noose. You won’t keep carrying on arrogantly; it’ll be a terrible time for you.

item.title: Micah 3
item.description:
Micah Chapter 3

1 I said, “Listen, leaders of Jacob, rulers of Israel. Aren’t you supposed to know what’s good,

2 you that hate good and love evil, who skin my people alive, pull the meat off their bones,

3 eat their flesh, break up their bones in pieces, and chop them up for the pot like meat in a kettle?"

4 You’ll call out to Yahveh, but he won’t answer you; he’ll turn away from you because of all your sins.

item.title: Micah 4
item.description:
Micah Chapter 4

1 In the last days, the mountain Yahveh’s Temple’s on will be the tallest mountain. It will loom above the hills, and the people from many nations will stream to it.

2 They’ll say, “Let’s go up to Yahveh’s mountain, to the Temple of Jacob’s God, so he can teach us his ways, and we can follow in his paths.” The Law will go out from Zion, Yahveh’s message from Jerusalem.

item.title: Micah 5
item.description:
Micah Chapter 5

1 Muster your troops, Jerusalem; they’re laying siege against you; they’ll hit Israel’s leader in the face with a rod.

2 But you, Bethlehem Ephrathah, though you’re small among Judah’s clans, you’ll have a ruler come out of you on my behalf in Israel. His origins are from long ago, from ancient times."

3 Israel will be abandoned till the one that’s in labor has the child; then the rest of his relatives will come back from exile.

item.title: Micah 6
item.description:
Micah Chapter 6

1 Listen to what Yahveh says: “Present to the mountains your case against me; let the hills hear your complaint.

2 But then listen, mountains, to Yahveh’s complaint, you enduring foundations of the world. He has a suit against his people; he’ll bring charges against Israel. 3"What have I done to you, my people? How have I wearied you? Answer me.

4 I brought you out of Egypt and ransomed you from slavery. I sent Moses, Aaron, and Miriam to lead you,

item.title: Micah 7
item.description:
Micah Chapter 7

1 Misfortune is waiting for me! I feel like people that pick fruit and gather grapes but have no clusters to eat or first-ripe figs to satisfy their hunger.

2 Godly people have disappeared; there aren’t any good ones left. They all premeditate murder; each hunts the other with a net.

3 Both hands do evil well, officials and judges both demand bribes, influential people vie for preferential treatment; together they weave injustice.
